ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'scyrte' (a shirt, tunic), from Proto-Germanic '*skurtijō' (short garment), related to Old Norse 'skyrta' (a shirt, kirtle), German 'Schürze' (apron). Originally referred to a short garment.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A garment for the upper body, typically made of light fabric, with a collar, sleeves, and an opening down the front, fastened with buttons.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种穿在上半身的服装，通常由轻薄面料制成，有领子、袖子和前襟开口，用纽扣固定。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He wore a clean white shirt to the interview.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他穿着一件干净的白衬衫去面试。
